CricketMatch.MatchReport:
What a great Sunday. Most of the Twyford side met in their local, the Duke of Wellington, for a hearty cooked breakfast and the soccer World Cup Final. To accommodate this the cricket started at 3.00pm and did not finish until 8.30.

Playing up at Gallowstree Common Twyford inserted the opposition on a lively track. Opener Fungai started to crack the ball all round the ground and the fielders quickly became difficult to spot on the very large, very quick, bone dry outfield. While Fungai raced to a hard hit hundred containing 16 fours the Twyford bowling was on top of the rest of the batting and gradually applied the brakes to the scoring rate. All of the bowlers did a really good job and by the mid point of the innings the fielders too were now back in evidence and much sharper. Oddfellows posted 169, probably 30-40 short of what had once looked likely.

In reply Woodman and Hall set off at more than 5 an over and gave the Twyford innings a great start. The late finish and inclement weather meant that the second half of the innings was played out in stygian gloom and Fungai brought on to try and get a much needed breakthrough bowled with fire and brimstone. Woodman fell with the opening partnership 2 short of a hundred. The following batsmen had a very uncomfortable time but Hall playing masterfully, saw the side home finishing unbeaten on 98.
